en: This is Rich Kleinfeldt.
zh: 我是 Rich Kleinfeldt。

en: And this is Sarah Long with THE MAKING OF A NATION,
zh: 这里是莎拉 · 朗为您带来的《建立一个国家》

en: a VOA Special English program about the history of the United States.
zh: 美国之音关于美国历史的特别英语节目。

en: Today, we tell about the movement of European settlers throughout northeastern America.
zh: 今天，我们讲述欧洲移民在美国东北部的迁移。

en: And we tell how the separate colonies developed in this area.
zh: 我们讲述了分离的殖民地是如何在这个地区发展起来的。

en: The Puritans were one of the largest groups from England to settle in the northeastern area called Massachusetts.
zh: 清教徒是来自英格兰最大的群体之一，定居在东北部地区称为马萨诸塞州。

en: They began arriving in 1630.
zh: 他们于1630年开始抵达。

en: The Puritans had formed the Massachusetts Bay Company in England.
zh: 清教徒在英国成立了马萨诸塞湾公司。

en: The king had given the company an area of land between the Charles and Merrimack rivers.
zh: 国王给了公司一块位于查尔斯河和 Merrimack 之间的土地。

en: The Puritans were Protestants who did not agree with the Anglican Church.
zh: 清教徒是新教徒，他们不同意英国国教。

en: The Puritans wanted to change the church to make it more holy.
zh: 清教徒想要改变教堂，使它更加神圣。

en: They were able to live as they wanted in Massachusetts.
zh: 在马萨诸塞州，他们可以随心所欲地生活。

en: Soon they became the largest religious group.
zh: 不久，他们成为最大的宗教团体。

en: By 1690, 50,000 people were living in Massachusetts.
zh: 到1690年，马萨诸塞州有5万人口。

en: Puritans thought their religion was the only true religion and everyone should believe in it.
zh: 清教徒认为他们的宗教是唯一真正的宗教，每个人都应该相信它。

en: They also believed that church leaders should lead the local government,
zh: 他们还认为教会领袖应该领导地方政府,

en: and all people in the colony should pay to support the Puritan church.
zh: 殖民地的所有人都应该支持清教徒教会。

en: The Puritans thought it was the job of government leaders to tell people what to believe.
zh: 清教徒认为政府领导人的工作就是告诉人们应该相信什么。

en: Some people did not agree with the Puritans who had become leaders of the colony.
zh: 有些人不同意已经成为殖民地领导人的清教徒。

en: One of those who disagreed was a Puritan minister named Roger Williams.
zh: 其中一位持不同意见的是一位名叫罗杰 · 威廉姆斯的清教徒牧师。

en: Roger Williams believed as all Puritans did that other European religions were wrong.
zh: 罗杰 · 威廉姆斯和所有清教徒一样，认为其他欧洲宗教是错误的。

en: He thought the Native Indian religions were wrong too.
zh: 他认为印第安人的宗教信仰也是错误的。

en: But he did not believe in trying to force others to agree with him.
zh: 但他不相信试图强迫别人同意他的观点。

en: He thought that it was a sin to punish or kill anyone in the name of Christianity.
zh: 他认为以基督教的名义惩罚或杀害任何人都是一种罪过。

en: And he thought that only church members should pay to support their church.
zh: 他认为，只有教会成员应该支付，以支持他们的教会。

en: Roger Williams began speaking and writing about his ideas.
zh: 罗杰 · 威廉姆斯开始讲述和写作他的想法。

en: He wrote a book saying it was wrong to punish people for having different beliefs.
zh: 他写了一本书，说惩罚有不同信仰的人是错误的。

en: Then he said that the European settlers were stealing the Indians' land.
zh: 然后他说欧洲殖民者在偷印第安人的土地。

en: He said the king of England had no right to permit people to settle on land that was not his,
zh: 他说英格兰国王无权允许人们在不属于他的土地上定居,

en: but belonged to the Indians.
zh: 而是属于印第安人的。

en: The Puritan leaders of the Massachusetts Bay Colony forced Roger Williams to leave the colony in 1636.
zh: 马萨诸塞湾殖民地的清教徒领导人于1636年迫使罗杰 · 威廉姆斯离开该殖民地。

en: He traveled south.
zh: 他去了南方。

en: He bought land from local Indians and started a city, Providence.
zh: 他从当地印第安人手中买下土地，建立了一座名为普罗维登斯的城市。

en: The Parliament in England gave him permission to establish a new colony, Rhode Island,
zh: 英国议会允许他建立一个新的殖民地，罗德岛,

en: with Providence as its capital.
zh: 以普罗维登斯为首都。

en: As a colony, Rhode Island accepted people of all religious beliefs,
zh: 作为一个殖民地，罗德岛接受所有宗教信仰的人,

en: including Catholics, Quakers, Jews and even people who denied the existence of God.
zh: 包括天主教徒、贵格会教徒、犹太人，甚至是否认上帝存在的人。

en: Roger Williams also believed that governments should have no connection to a church.
zh: 罗杰 · 威廉姆斯还认为，政府不应该与教会有任何联系。

en: This idea of separating church and state was very new.
zh: 这种将政教分离的想法非常新颖。

en: Later it became one of the most important of all America's governing ideas.
zh: 后来，它成为美国所有治理思想中最重要的一个。

en: Other colonies were started by people who left Massachusetts to seek land.
zh: 其他的殖民地则是由离开马萨诸塞州寻找土地的人们建立起来的。

en: One was Connecticut.
zh: 一个是康涅狄格州。

en: A group led by Puritan minister Thomas Hooker left Boston in 1636 and went west.
zh: 1636年，一个由清教徒部长托马斯 · 胡克领导的组织离开波士顿，向西进发。

en: They settled near the Connecticut River.
zh: 他们在康涅狄格河附近定居。

en: Others soon joined them.
zh: 其他人很快也加入了他们。

en: Other groups from Massachusetts traveled north to find new homes.
zh: 其他来自马萨诸塞州的团体北上寻找新的家园。

en: The king of England had given two friends a large piece of land in the north.
zh: 英格兰国王在北方给了两个朋友一大片土地。

en: The friends divided it.
zh: 朋友们把它分了。

en: John Mason took what later became the colony of New Hampshire.
zh: 约翰 · 梅森占领了后来成为新罕布什尔州殖民地的地区。

en: Ferdinando Gorges took the area that later became the state of Maine.
zh: 费迪南多·乔治爵士占领了后来成为缅因州的地区。

en: It never became a colony, however.
zh: 然而，它从未成为一个殖民地。

en: It remained a part of Massachusetts until after the United States was created.
zh: 它一直是马萨诸塞州的一部分，直到美利坚合众国建立。

en: The area known today as New York State was settled by the Dutch.
zh: 今天被称为纽约州的地区是由荷兰人定居的。

en: They called it New Netherland.
zh: 他们称之为 New Netherland。

en: Their country was the Netherlands.
zh: 他们的国家是荷兰。

en: It was a great world power, with colonies all over the world.
zh: 它是一个世界强国，殖民地遍布世界各地。

en: A business called the Dutch West India Company owned most of the colonies.
zh: 一家名为荷兰西印度公司的企业拥有大部分殖民地。

en: The Dutch claimed American land because of explorations by Henry Hudson,
zh: 因为亨利 · 哈德森的探险，荷兰人宣称对美国领土拥有主权,

en: an Englishman working for the Netherlands.
zh: 为荷兰工作的英国人。

en: The land the Dutch claimed was between the Puritans in the north and the Anglican tobacco farmers in the south.
zh: 荷兰人声称的土地位于北方的清教徒和南方的圣公会烟农之间。

en: The Dutch were not interested in settling the territory.
zh: 荷兰人对定居领土不感兴趣。

en: They wanted to earn money.
zh: 他们想赚钱。

en: The Dutch West India Company built trading posts on the rivers claimed by the Netherlands.
zh: 荷兰西印度公司在荷兰声称拥有主权的河流上建立了贸易站。

en: People in Europe wanted to buy goods made from the skins of animals trapped there.
zh: 欧洲人希望购买用困在那里的动物皮制成的商品。

en: In 1626, the Dutch West India Company bought two islands from the local Indians.
zh: 1626年，荷兰西印度公司从当地印第安人手中买下了两个岛屿。

en: The islands are Manhattan Island and Long Island.
zh: 这些岛屿是曼哈顿岛和长岛。

en: Traditional stories say the Dutch paid for the islands with some trade goods worth about twenty-four dollars.
zh: 传统的说法是，荷兰人用一些价值约24美元的贸易货物来购买这些岛屿。

en: The Dutch West India Company tried to find people to settle in America.
zh: 荷兰西印度公司试图找到在美国定居的人。

en: But few Dutch wanted to leave Europe.
zh: 但几乎没有荷兰人想离开欧洲。

en: So the colony welcomed people from other colonies, and other countries.
zh: 因此，殖民地欢迎来自其他殖民地和其他国家的人。

en: These people built a town on Manhattan Island.
zh: 这些人在曼哈顿岛上建了一个小镇。

en: They called it New Amsterdam.
zh: 他们称之为新阿姆斯特丹。

en: It was soon full of people who had arrived on ships from faraway places.
zh: 很快就挤满了从遥远的地方乘船来到这里的人。

en: It was said you could hear as many as 18 different languages spoken in New Amsterdam.
zh: 据说在新阿姆斯特丹你可以听到多达18种不同的语言。

en: In 1655, the governor of New Netherland took control of a nearby Swedish colony on Delaware Bay.
zh: 1655年，New Netherland 总督控制了特拉华湾附近的瑞典殖民地。

en: In 1664, the English did the same to the Dutch.
zh: 1664年，英国人对荷兰人做了同样的事。

en: The English seized control of New Amsterdam and called it New York.
zh: 英国人夺取了新阿姆斯特丹的控制权，称之为纽约。

en: That ended Dutch control of the territory that now is the states of New York, New Jersey and Delaware.
zh: 这结束了荷兰对该地区的控制，现在是纽约州，新泽西州和特拉华州。

en: Most of the Dutch in New Amsterdam did not leave.
zh: 新阿姆斯特丹的大多数荷兰人没有离开。

en: The English permitted everyone to stay.
zh: 英国人允许每个人留下来。

en: They let the Dutch have religious freedom.
zh: 他们让荷兰人有宗教自由。

en: The Dutch were just not in control any more.
zh: 荷兰人已经失去了控制。

en: The Duke of York owned the area now.
zh: 约克公爵现在拥有这片区域。

en: He was the brother of King Charles the Second of England.
zh: 他是英格兰国王查尔斯二世的弟弟。

en: The king gave some of the land near New York to two friends,
zh: 国王把纽约附近的一些土地分给了两个朋友,

en: Sir George Carteret and Lord John Berkeley.
zh: 乔治 · 卡特里特爵士和约翰 · 伯克利勋爵。

en: They called it New Jersey, after the English island where Carteret was born.
zh: 他们称之为新泽西，以卡特里特出生的英国小岛命名。

en: The two men wrote a plan of government for their colony.
zh: 这两个人为他们的殖民地起草了一份政府计划。

en: It created an assembly that represented the settlers.
zh: 它创建了一个代表定居者的集会。

en: It provided for freedom of religion.
zh: 它规定了宗教自由。

en: Men could vote in New Jersey whatever their religion.
zh: 在新泽西，不管信仰什么，男人都可以投票。

en: Soon, people from all parts of Europe were living in New Jersey.
zh: 很快，来自欧洲各地的人们都住在新泽西州。

en: Then King Charles took control of the area.
zh: 然后查尔斯国王控制了这个地区。

en: He sent a royal governor to rule.
zh: 他派了一位皇家总督来统治。

en: But the colonists were permitted to make their own laws through the elected assembly.
zh: 但是殖民者被允许通过选举产生的议会来制定他们自己的法律。

en: The king of England did the same in each colony he controlled.
zh: 英格兰国王在他控制的每个殖民地都做了同样的事情。

en: He collected taxes from the people who lived there,
zh: 他向住在那里的人们收税,

en: but permitted them to govern themselves.
zh: 但允许他们自己管理自己。

en: One religious group that was not welcome in England was the Quakers.
zh: 一个在英国不受欢迎的宗教团体是贵格会。

en: Quakers call themselves Friends.
zh: 贵格会教徒称自己为朋友。

en: They believe that each person has an inner light that leads them to God.
zh: 他们相信每个人都有一道内在的光引导他们到达上帝。

en: Quakers believe they do not need a religious leader to tell them what is right.
zh: 贵格会教徒相信他们不需要宗教领袖来告诉他们什么是正确的。

en: So, they had no clergy.
zh: 所以他们没有神职人员。

en: Quakers believe that all people are equal.
zh: 贵格会教徒相信人人平等。

en: The Quakers in England refused to recognize the king as more important than anyone else.
zh: 英国贵格会拒绝承认国王比任何人都重要。

en: They also refused to pay taxes to support the Anglican Church.
zh: 他们还拒绝纳税来支持英国国教。

en: Quakers believe that it is always wrong to kill.
zh: 贵格会教徒认为杀戮永远是错误的。

en: So they would not fight even when they were forced to join the army.
zh: 所以即使被迫参军，他们也不会战斗。

en: They also refuse to promise loyalty to a king or government or flag or anyone but God.
zh: 他们也拒绝向国王、政府、旗帜或除上帝以外的任何人承诺忠诚。

en: The English did not like the Quakers for all these reasons.
zh: 由于这些原因，英国人不喜欢贵格会。

en: Many Quakers wanted to leave England,
zh: 许多贵格会教徒想离开英格兰,

en: but they were not welcome in most American colonies.
zh: 但他们在大多数美洲殖民地并不受欢迎。

en: One Quaker changed this.
zh: 一个贵格会教徒改变了这一切。

en: His name was William Penn.
zh: 他叫 William Penn。

en: William Penn was not born a Quaker.
zh: William Penn 不是天生的贵格会教徒。

en: He became one as a young man.
zh: 他年轻的时候就成为了一个合格的人。

en: His father was an Anglican, and a good friend of the king.
zh: 他的父亲是英国国教徒，也是国王的好朋友。

en: King Charles borrowed money from William's father.
zh: 查尔斯国王向威廉的父亲借钱。

en: When his father died, William Penn asked that the debt be paid with land in America.
zh: 父亲去世后，威廉 · 佩恩要求用美国的土地偿还债务。

en: In 1681, the king gave William Penn land which the King's Council named Pennsylvania, meaning Penn's woods.
zh: 1681年，国王把宾夕法尼亚州命名为宾夕法尼亚州，意思是宾夕法尼亚州的森林。

en: The Quakers now had their own colony.
zh: 贵格会现在有了自己的殖民地。

en: It was between the Puritans in the north and the Anglicans in the south.
zh: 它介于北方的清教徒和南方的圣公会教徒之间。

en: William Penn said the colony should be a place where everyone could live by Quaker ideas.
zh: 威廉 · 佩恩说，殖民地应该是一个每个人都可以按照贵格会教徒的思想生活的地方。

en: That meant treating all people as equals and honoring all religions.
zh: 这意味着平等对待所有人，尊重所有宗教。

en: It also meant that anyone could be elected.
zh: 这也意味着任何人都可以当选。

en: In most other colonies, people could believe any religion,
zh: 在大多数其他殖民地，人们可以相信任何宗教,

en: but they could not vote or hold office unless they were a member of the majority church.
zh: 但是，除非他们是多数派教会的成员，否则他们不能投票或担任公职。

en: In Pennsylvania, all religions were equal.
zh: 在宾夕法尼亚州，所有的宗教都是平等的。

en: This MAKING OF A NATION program was written by Nancy Steinbach and produced by Paul Thompson.
zh: 本节目由南希 · 斯坦巴赫撰写，保罗 · 汤普森制作。

en: This is Sarah Long.
zh: 我是 Sarah Long。

zh: 这位是 Rich Kleinfeldt。
